Description: Fragment of rim of pottery amphora (?). Medium-fine, reddish-brown clay with much gold mica, Nile silt? Red-fired glaze outside and band at top inside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski 2001, 58 no. E 2 pl. 27.2, considers the piece to be a one-handled cup of the 4th - 3rd century BC
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 58, no. E2, pl. 27, 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.03)
